content: @hooked graces 1 the devon crop p 2-3 materials measurements + abbreviations p 3-4 main body of the top p 4-5 front panel of the top p 5 top border and straps p 7-9 tester lookbook terms of pattern use this pattern is for personal use only the garments made from this pattern can be sold on but please give me credit copying this pattern in written or video form is prohibited @hooked graces 2 you will need o 1-4 skeins of west yorkshire spinners the croft dk yarn varying according to size or a dk weight yarn as an alternative i am a size small with a 26 inch waist measurement and i used approximately 338 metres 368 yards of the croft dk yarn when creating the top in a different yarn that was 100% acrylic i used approximately 279 metres 305 yards o 4mm crochet hook or hook suggested for your yarn o darning needle o stitch markers o measuring tape o scissors measurements the top made with this pattern is created to be made to measure so you will use your own waist measurements to create the size you can also adjust the height of the main body by removing row before you begin working on the front panel terminology & abbreviations this pattern is written in uk terminology blo = work stitch es into the back loop of the stitch only chain = chain double_crochet = double_crochet single_crochet in us terminology decrease = double_crochet decrease htc = half treble_crochet half_double_crochet in us terminology @hooked graces 3 repeat = repeat slip_stitch = slip_stitch st s = stitch es main body this part of the top is worked in rounds in order to keep the pattern created when double_crochet is worked on the flat at the end of the row you will slip_stitch into the first stitch of the round just completed and turn your work so that you are now working back the way you just came beginning the next round on the last st of the last round row 1 with a 4mm hook chain 11 double_crochet into the 2nd chain from the hook and in each stitch along the row chain 1 turn row 2 double_crochet in the back loop of each stitch of the row chain 1 turn repeat row 2 until your work is equal in length to the waist measurement that you have taken when slightly stretched make a note of the number of row completed this will be referred to as r ex my waist measurement was 26 inches so i repeated row 2 until my work measured 26 inches when slightly stretched equal to 84 row slip_stitch the top and bottom of the work together chain 1 turn your work so that the sl sts are facing inwards at this point i suggest trying your work on this should fit snuggly around your waist with the work slightly stretched it should not be too tight as the rounds will become
